meanings.definition: A hormone released by the brain that blocks pain and produces feelings of pleasure.
meanings.sent1: After exercising, my body released endorphins that made me feel happy and pain-free.
meanings.sent2: Endorphins are like natural painkillers that our brain produces when we are in a good mood.
meanings.sent3: I like to think of endorphins as tiny happiness molecules bouncing around in my brain.
meanings.sent4: Endorphins are like magical pain blockers that turn discomfort into joy.
meanings.sent5: The endorphins flooded my system, creating a blissful state of euphoria.

meanings.definition: Any of a group of peptides occurring in the brain and other tissues that bind to the same receptors as opiate drugs and have potent analgesic effects.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how endorphins work as natural pain relievers in our bodies.
meanings.sent2: Endorphins are substances that help us manage pain by interacting with specific receptors in our brain.
meanings.sent3: I joked that endorphins are like tiny superheroes fighting off pain villains in our bodies.
meanings.sent4: Endorphins act like keys that unlock the doors to pain relief in our brain.
meanings.sent5: The endorphins rushed to the rescue, numbing the ache with their powerful effects.
